title.native: ボールルームへようこそ

description:
Fujita has drifted through middle school aimlessly, unable to find friends or anything that can hold his attention. Then, one day, he's attacked by a gang and saved by a mysterious man. But this isn't a karate master; it's a ballroom dance instructor! Reluctantly, Fujita takes a few beginner's classes, only to find his inspiration... an entrancing, teenage dance prodigy named Shizuku.
It's Fujita's first step into the high-octane world of competitive dance!

(Source: Kodansha USA)

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Rehabilitation

tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/T2taketom)

She graduated from Musashino Art University.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jokerendcard)

Itazu joined [Studio Gallop](https://anilist.co/studio/36/) in 1998 at the young age of 18. Five years later he started a collaboration with studio [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Here he was involved in the production of the TV series [Paranoia Agent](https://anilist.co/anime/323/), which put him in touch with director [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/). After his outstanding performance in the series [Dennou Coil](https://anilist.co/anime/2164/) as a chief animation director, Kon invited him aboard the production of [The Dream Machine](https://anilist.co/anime/6585/) as character designer and chief animation director, but the project was sadly suspended when Kon passed away in 2010. Itazu eventually got to make his debut as a character designer on [Miss Hokusai](https://anilist.co/anime/20709/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suemitsu)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)

name.native: ユニゾン・スクエア・ガーデン

node.description: Website | Twitter Unison Square Garden, stylized as UNISON SQUARE GARDEN, is a 3 member boy band under the record label TOY'S FACTORY (formerly under UK PROJECT). Members: - Kousuke Saitou (斎藤宏介) (Vocal & Guitar) - [Tomoya Tabuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/148232/Tomoya-Tabuchi) (田淵智也) (Vocal & Bass) - Takao Suzuki (鈴木貴雄) (Vocal & Drums) (Source: jpop.fandom.com)

[Profile](http://www.hirata-office.jp/talent_profile/woman/mikako_komatsu.html) | [Artist Profile](https://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/mikakokomatsu/) | [Website](https://www.hirata-office.jp/komatsu_mikako/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mikakokomatsu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mikako_komatsu/)

A Japanese voice actor affiliated with Hirata Office. She married fellow voice actor [Tomoaki Maeno](https://anilist.co/staff/96489/Tomoaki-Maeno) on May 12, 2020.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Centi - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Feixiao - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
[Takaaki Chiba](https://anilist.co/staff/147856/)'s brother.
__Hiromi Kikuta__ is a Japanese sound director, who works for the company Rakuonsha.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jokerendcard)

Itazu joined [Studio Gallop](https://anilist.co/studio/36/) in 1998 at the young age of 18. Five years later he started a collaboration with studio [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Here he was involved in the production of the TV series [Paranoia Agent](https://anilist.co/anime/323/), which put him in touch with director [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/). After his outstanding performance in the series [Dennou Coil](https://anilist.co/anime/2164/) as a chief animation director, Kon invited him aboard the production of [The Dream Machine](https://anilist.co/anime/6585/) as character designer and chief animation director, but the project was sadly suspended when Kon passed away in 2010. Itazu eventually got to make his debut as a character designer on [Miss Hokusai](https://anilist.co/anime/20709/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/niuya) | [Weibo](https://www.weibo.com/niuya123)

Liang moved to Japan in 2007 in order to further her art studies, taking up professional drawing classes and graduating in 2011. She joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) right afterwards, becoming a key animator after one year of working for the company.

She has named [Toshiyuki Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/103724/) as one of her main influences.

__[Website](https://www.tsubasanium.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tsubasacurry)__ 

__Tsubasa Itou__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and orchestrator.
Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jokerendcard)

Itazu joined [Studio Gallop](https://anilist.co/studio/36/) in 1998 at the young age of 18. Five years later he started a collaboration with studio [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Here he was involved in the production of the TV series [Paranoia Agent](https://anilist.co/anime/323/), which put him in touch with director [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/). After his outstanding performance in the series [Dennou Coil](https://anilist.co/anime/2164/) as a chief animation director, Kon invited him aboard the production of [The Dream Machine](https://anilist.co/anime/6585/) as character designer and chief animation director, but the project was sadly suspended when Kon passed away in 2010. Itazu eventually got to make his debut as a character designer on [Miss Hokusai](https://anilist.co/anime/20709/).

[Twitter](http://twitter.com/i/user/336690901)

Originating from [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1522114648098619397)

He grew up admiring anime such as [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/1650/) an during highschool he started animating with his friends. He enrolled into a professional animation school after graduating but quit quickly due to being disappointed in how the lessons were conducted.

He joined Anime R and later its subsidiary Studio Muu. His first work was as an in-betweener on [Psycho Armor Govarian](https://anilist.co/anime/6428/) while his debut as a key animator was on [Captain Tsubasa](https://anilist.co/anime/2116/).

After working on [Mamoru Oshii](https://anilist.co/staff/99097/)'s [Patlabor](https://anilist.co/anime/1095/) he permanently joined Production I.G. becoming known, together with [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Tetsuya Nishio](https://anilist.co/staff/103725/), as "The Three Gods of I.G."

He's is one of the most prominent animators of the realist school, with emphasis on solid shapes and weighty character animation.
Haruo Okuno is an animator, animation director and character designer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taizouzo)

Mostly directs and storyboards nowadays, having more or less retired as an animator.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/原恵一)

An award winning freelance director.
Occasional animator.
